Package com

Class CreditCardController

java.lang.Object
com.CreditCardController
@RestController
public class CreditCardController
extends java.lang.Object
Author:
Mario Ruiz Rojo
JSON REST controller that serves to the client the management operations of the credit card list from the business layer
It validates JSON parameters and returns BAD_REQUEST(400) http response if validation fails

    • getCreditCards

      @RequestMapping("/getCreditCards") public java.util.List<CreditCard> getCreditCards()
      GET request handler that returns he list of credit cards
      Returns:
      JSON list of credit cards

    • addCreditCard

      @RequestMapping("/addCreditCard") public Response addCreditCard​(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid CreditCard creditCard)
      POST request handler that adds one credit card to the list of credit cards
      Parameters:
      creditCard - credit card to add
      Returns:
      JSON response to confirm operation success

    • deleteCreditCard

      @RequestMapping("/deleteCreditCard") public Response deleteCreditCard​(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid Id id)
      POST request handler that deletes one credit card that is already in the list of credit cards
      Parameters:
      id - identifier of the credit card to delete
      Returns:
      JSON response to confirm operation success

    • updateCreditCard

      @RequestMapping("/updateCreditCard") public Response updateCreditCard​(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid CreditCard creditCard)
      POST request handler that updates one credit card that is already in the list of credit cards
      Parameters:
      creditCard - credit card to add
      Returns:
      JSON response to confirm operation success

    • handleValidationExceptions

      @ResponseStatus(BAD_REQUEST) @ExceptionHandler(org.springframework.web.bind.MethodArgumentNotValidException.class) public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> handleValidationExceptions​(org.springframework.web.bind.MethodArgumentNotValidException ex)
      Exception's validator catcher, it sends http 400 to the client if validation fails
      Parameters:
      ex - exception raised by the validator
      Returns:
      JSON response with a dictionary containing the CreditCard class attribute and its error
